articles.author: Samia Nakhoul, Suleiman Al-Khalidi
articles.description: Jordan has foiled a suspected Iranian-led plot to smuggle weapons into the U.S.-allied kingdom to help opponents of the ruling monarchy carry out acts of sabotage, according to two Jordanian sources with knowledge of the matter.
articles.title: Jordan foils arms plot as kingdom caught in Iran-Israel shadow war

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: Russian President Vladimir Putin, in an interview published early on Wednesday, said he backed China's plan for a peaceful settlement of the Ukraine crisis, saying Beijing had a full understanding of what lay behind the crisis.
articles.title: Putin backs China's Ukraine peace plan, says Beijing understands the conflict

articles.author: Nidal Al-Mughrabi
articles.description: Israeli tanks forged deeper into eastern Rafah, reaching some residential districts on Tuesday, stepping up an offensive in the southern border city where more than a million people had been sheltering after being displaced in seven months of war.
articles.title: Israeli tanks push into Gaza's Rafah, as displaced civilians flee again

articles.author: Kirsty Needham
articles.description: Gunshots could be heard and schools remained shut in New Caledonia's capital Noumea on Wednesday morning after a night of rioting despite a curfew, as France's National Assembly approved changes to voting rules in the Pacific island.
articles.title: New Caledonia riots rage on after Paris approves voting change

articles.author: Greg Torode, Guy Faulconbridge
articles.description: Russian President Vladimir Putin's Beijing visit on Thursday is likely to be light on hard deals but will mark the start of his new presidential term with a show of support from his most powerful political partner, Chinese counterpart Xi Jinping.
articles.title: Defying West, Russia's Putin set to meet Xi Jinping in Beijing

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: The search for 35 people who are still missing from flash floods and mud slides in Indonesia's West Sumatra province continued on Wednesday, authorities said, as the death toll from the weekend disaster rose to 58.
articles.title: Indonesia searches for 35 still missing in deadly Sumatra floods

articles.author: Vitalii Hnidyi, Ivan Lyubysh-Kirdey, Yuliia Dysa
articles.description: Ukraine's military said on Tuesday its forces pulled back to new positions in two areas of the northeastern Kharkiv region where Moscow is pressing an offensive, and warned of a Russian force buildup to the north near its Sumy region.
articles.title: Ukraine pulls back in two areas of Kharkiv region, warns of buildup near Sumy region

articles.author: Simon Lewis
articles.description: U.S. Secretary of State Antony Blinken arrived in Kyiv on Tuesday in the first visit to Ukraine by a senior U.S. official since Congress passed a long-delayed $61 billion military aid package for the country last month.
articles.title: Blinken arrives in Ukraine in show of US solidarity amid Russian attacks

articles.author: Michelle Nichols
articles.description: North Korea laundered $147.5 million through virtual currency platform Tornado Cash in March after stealing it last year from a cryptocurrency exchange, according to confidential work by United Nations sanctions monitors seen by Reuters on Tuesday.
articles.title: Exclusive: North Korea laundered $147.5 mln in stolen crypto in March, say UN experts

articles.author: Ben Blanchard
articles.description: Taiwanese drag queen Nymphia Wind celebrated last month's win on RuPaul's Drag Race by staging a riotous, emotional performance at Taiwan's presidential office on Wednesday in front of President Tsai Ing-wen.
articles.title: Taiwan drag queens bring their glamour to presidential office celebrating RuPaul win
